sentences.en: ‘We’ll have to leave,’ she said with a resigned sigh.
sentences.cn: “我们不得不走啊。”她无奈地叹息道。

sentences.en: Barry resigned his directorship in December 1973.
sentences.cn: 巴里于1973年12月辞去了他的董事之职。

sentences.en: Carrington did the honourable thing and resigned.
sentences.cn: 卡林顿作出了令人敬佩的举动，辞了职。

sentences.en: Columbia recently resigned the band for a cool $30 million.
sentences.cn: 哥伦比亚唱片公司最近以3,000万美元的高价再次签下这个乐队。

sentences.en: He had resigned himself to watching the European Championships on television.
sentences.cn: 他只好将就着在电视上看欧洲锦标赛。

sentences.en: He resigned as Home Secretary and returned to the back benches.
sentences.cn: 他辞去了内政大臣的职务，回到后座议员席。

sentences.en: He resigned as manager after eight years.
sentences.cn: 八年后，他辞去了经理的职务。

sentences.en: He resigned from his post as Bishop when the scandal broke.
sentences.cn: 丑闻传开后他辞去了主教职务。

sentences.en: He resigned his directorship and left the firm.
sentences.cn: 他放弃了董事职务,离开了公司.

sentences.en: He was resigned to never seeing his birthplace again.
sentences.cn: 永远不再去他的出生地，他也认了。

sentences.en: I was resigned to serving out the sentence.
Pauline was already resigned to losing her home.
sentences.cn: 保利娜已经无奈地接受了失去家园的事实。

sentences.en: She had earlier resigned her post as President Menem's assistant.
sentences.cn: 她早些时候辞去了梅内姆总统助理一职。

sentences.en: She has resigned herself to fate.

words.tran_cn: 顺从的；已辞职的；己放弃的

trans.tran_cn: 已辞职的，已放弃的，顺从的，听从的
trans.tran_en: a resigned look, voice etc shows that you are making yourself accept something that you do not like

trans.tran_cn: 辞职，放弃(resign的过去式)，(to)使顺从
